titles.title: To prohibit the award of a Federal contract unless the contractor agrees to offer their employees certain health insurance benefits.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Government Reform.

bill.summary: 3/24/2004--Introduced. Prohibits giving any advantage to a proposal for outsourcing to save costs for the Federal Government by: (1) failing to offer employer-sponsored health insurance benefits to workers to be employed under the contract; or (2) offering employer-sponsored health insurance benefits to such workers that are less than the benefits provided for Federal employees under the Federal Employees Health Benefit plan.
